result.execSummary:
The defendant Paula M. Smekofske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Paula M. Smekofske
parties.address: W11486 Goldsmith Rd, Black River Falls, WI 54615

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Payable as follows:  $50.00 per month, starting on or before March 1, 2016 and on the same day thereafter each month, until paid in full.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.  Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Sentence to start on or before March 11, 2016 at 6 pm.  Stay conditioned on the defendant not being charged with any further crimes, intoxication or drug paraphernalia.  If defendant tests positive, or fails to appear for any appointments with her social worker, or any of the above occurs, stay to be lifted immediately.  May serve on EMP, according to jail rules.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Paula M. Smekofske
Current: 521 Naragansette Ave, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 08-31-2017)
Prior: 109 Maplewood Court #38, Black River Falls, WI 54615

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Plead guilty to Count 1 in 15CM272.  Plead guilty to Count 2 in 15CM275.  DRI other counts.    Victim notification complied with.    Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the count she is pleading to.  She understood.  Court confirmed prior conviction.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of count 1 in 15CM272 and found guilty of Count 2 in 15CM275, DC, as a repeater.  Other counts in those cases dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   State recommended 6 months jail.  Concurrent.  Attorney Sebion recommended 60 days, concurrent.   Credit for 3 days on 15CM272.  Defendant did not elect to exercise her right to allocution.  Court ordered 6 months jail, concurrent.  Report on or before 3/11/16 at 6:00 pm.  Conditioned on not being with any further crimes, intoxication or drug para.  Test positive or fails to appear to social worker.  Credit for 3 days on 15CM272.  May serve on EMP, according to jail rules.  Report for booking in 15CM275.  CC.  DNA surcharge and sample.  Pay CC @ 50/mo 3/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

Covers 15CM272 and 15CM275.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request. Not to change mailing address unless notify court.  AMENDED 12/14/15.  May be present at the Ho-Chunk Casino for work purposes only.  Furnish her supervison with a copy of this bond.

Defense requests work exception in her bond.
